reviewText: So smart and clever.

Smart, funny, and sophisticated enough to make it a crossover hit for American audiences.  A prosperous couple decide to take friends and family on a Mediterranean cruise to celebrate their 25th wedding anniversary. Mayhem ensues (narrated by the family dog!)
One of the best flims I have seen!
Absolutely loved it.
True portrayal of Corporate families where children are mere pawns in the game of chess.
great movie
I LOVE IT. great movie ! plz watch. wow. just wow. first class. A1. Brilliant. Good job Zoya! Kudos to you all!!
great movie!

I enjoyed every bit of this 3-hour movie. If you are looking for the typically rushed movie quickie that leaves you wondering what happens; the length of this movie is not for you. A great modern storyline in addition to the Bollywood dance scenes organically being placed into the movie.  Absolutely great cast.
Fantastic movie. Stellar cast.
Great film! Must see! It's actually really funny but also goes into the serious aspects of parent-children relationships!
Amazing - great songs, hilarious and touching; and all around a delightful movie.
Excellent movie and glad to have as part of the home movie collection
great movie
Enjoyed the scenery & some comical family drama
love this movie
Such a long movie! Never got to finish it. It was going by way too slow and who has time for a 3 hour movie anyway?
Good clean family movie, cute!
The quality of the movie wasn't nice and it stopped several times during its play
Good acting and stuff just gets REAL 3/4 way through the comedy.

I have rented this movie twice through Amazon now. Both times I have had the same problem. There is a time delay in the subtitles. The subtitles are seriously delayed and lagging behind  in each scene of the movie so that it is impossible to follow the movie. I am so disappointed. I really feel I should be reimbursed for this rental.
Loved it
Great Hindi movie

very cool movie.
Dil  Dhadakne Do was a fun and entertaining movie making fun of a topical messed up family.
loved it

Zoya Akhtar does it again! Distances create by generation gaps, despite everyone's best intentions, are a reality for most families. Ms. Akhtar handles the subject with elegance and sensitivity, without taking sides or assigning blame.
One of the few films I'd call a "must watch".
I give this movie two stars for two reasons: 1) Priyanka Chopra and 2) the subtitles were off.
Very entertaining, I enjoyed it very much.
Family drama
Solid movie, very NRI friendly.
DDD is a fun romantic comedy/light drama with likable characters and great music and dance numbers.
Highly entertaining family drama that provide insight in to psyche of rich and famous of India elite

The image shown says there are 2 DVDs. One was the specials which is what I wanted. However the dvd I received only had the one DVD which was the movie. What happened to the second DVD?

Excellent movie and perfect for american viewers.  This movie portrays what the young generation are doing today with or without parents permission, however, this movie brings out the importance of parents understanding their children's needs in this modern day and age.

I watched this on the airline headed to Delhi. Really, I got laughed at by my gf for liking a Bollywood movie, but it was really entertaining, and being an emotional person, I was choked up half the time during the touching scenes!

Very well done. A great global story showing one culture's individual and family struggles adapting to a different world with new challenges. It's long for a romantic comedy but the reason is that you're treated to Bollywood-esque music and dancing.
I don't know why I waited so long to watch this movie. Amazing cast and story line.
watched it 10 times already.. CLASSIC
What a treat to the eyes! Beautifully directed by the amazing Zoya Akhtar. Has to be included as one of my classics collections.
Funny with a great message.

An absolute horrific movie.  no story line...just a bunch of "kala aungraji's" trying to be "western" and complaining.  any movie with anuska sharma has to be horrible.  what is it with Indian movies now that just want to copy american movies but without a story line.
save your 20 mins and avoid this like the plague.
A must watch!

This movie is a testament to Zoya Akhtar's directorial skills. I've seen badly executed attempts in Bollywood at drama movies such as this one, but with this movie she has shown how it's done. After ZNMD, this movie is right up her alley.
Very well made indian mello-drama.
Priyanka Chopra!  Oh My Gosh!  Love that girl.
